reviews.review_msg: If you haven't done programming AND linguistics before, it's difficult. Lots of material for one semester, so it goes quickly, with little background info, and not in-depth. Labs are straightforward intros to Python. Group assignments are more open-ended. Tests are open-book and straightforward. But the marking seems more harsh than the rubric.

I loved Maite, she was so sweet and so knowledgeable, and she's so smart. 
It is an introduction to Python class, so it scared the soul outta me but she made it bearable and easygoing, it's one of the best-organized classes I've taken. 
It is a lot of info though, not easy, but she makes it worthwhile.

Incredibly kind woman and very good prof, I really enjoyed this class. As someone with no coding experience prior it was difficult but not unmanageable, and she was very helpful in office hours when I had questions.
